title: Switch Online launches next month, Nintendo confirms
description:
![](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-
reviews-placeholder-3.svg)

**The Switch free-play party is almost over. Nintendo has confirmed that
it’s**[ **Switch Online paid
service**](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/nintendo-switch-online-3469385)
**will be launching in the second half of September, bringing to an end the
online free-for-all of** ** _Mario Kart and Splatoon 2_**

> The
[#NintendoSwitchOnline](https://twitter.com/hashtag/NintendoSwitchOnline?src=hash&ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw)
paid membership service will launch in the second half of September, providing
access to online play, Save Data Cloud backup in compatible games, and a
growing library of NES titles with added online play.<https://t.co/R3Ftvxd8Ft>

>

> — Nintendo of Europe (@NintendoEurope) [August 10,
2018](https://twitter.com/NintendoEurope/status/1027826911593025536?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw)

Nintendo has been promising the online service since last year, but only
revealed more details this year. In essence, it’s very similar to the services
set up by rivals Microsoft and Sony for the
[Xbox](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/xbox-one-x) and
[PlayStation](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/ps4-pro) families. Users
pay a subscription, and in return can take part in online play, backup their
saved games to the cloud and enjoy a selection of free titles. Only, in this
case, Nintendo’s selection of free games currently only includes remastered
NES games with added online play.

**Related:**[ **Upcoming Nintendo Switch
games**](https://www.trustedreviews.com/best/upcoming-nintendo-switch-
games-3522184)

In Nintendo’s defence, this considerably more meagre offering also comes at a
much lower price. You can get one month’s access for £3.49/$3.99, three months
for £6.99/$7.99 or a whole year’s access to multiplayer Nintendo fun for
£17.99/$19.99. That’s slightly less than half the cost of rival offerings.

Of course, said rivals don’t just have the older free games to point to when
arguing about their value. There’s a real shortage of Switch games that
currently support online play making it a slightly trickier sell. At the
moment, fans seem to be making do with [Mario Kart
8](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/mario-kart-8-deluxe),
[_Fortnite_](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/fortnite-battle-royale)
and [_Splatoon 2_](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/splatoon-2) , though
[_Super Smash Bros Ultimate_](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/super-smash-
bros-ultimate-release-date-gameplay-roster-stages-2949964) may well sell a few
subscriptions on its own.

When Switch Online is officially launched in the second half of September,
free online play will be a thing of the past, leaving current players with a
simple choice: stick to offline play, or pay up. Unfortunately, with _Super
Smash Bros Ultimate_ launching in December, there won’t be time to try before
they buy.

**Will you pay for Switch Online, or do you prefer your single-player gaming?
Let us know with a quick message on Twitter to @TrustedReviews**
